definition: to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The detention house is the main place for the implementation of pre-trial detention.
sentences.chinese: 看守所是我国审前羁押的主要执行场所。

sentences.english: Reporters arrived at the detention center, Dong Lin has been eating a bowl Fentang.
sentences.chinese: 记者刚到看守所时，董林已经吃了一大碗粉汤。

sentences.english: The police carted the criminals away to the lockup for prisoners.
sentences.chinese: 警察把罪犯用车押送到看守所。

sentences.english: Al-Zaidi marked his 30th birthday in jail last month.
sentences.chinese: 扎伊迪于上月在看守所度过了他30岁的生日。

sentences.english: He evaded about 20 reporters waiting for him outside the detention centre.
sentences.chinese: 他避开守在看守所外的约二十名记者。

sentences.english: The detention center and local police in Puning did not buy Warhammer Online Gold answer questions.
sentences.chinese: 晋宁看守所和当地警方没有回答问询。

sentences.english: The government did not permit inspection of prisons or detention camps by human rights monitors.
sentences.chinese: 政府不允许人权监督人员对监狱和看守所进行视察。

sentences.english: The detention center and local police in Puning did not answer questions.
sentences.chinese: 晋宁看守所和当地警方没有回答问询。

sentences.english: People caught in the formalities, and sent to the detention house.
sentences.chinese: 人抓到了，在办理各种手续后送进了看守所。

sentences.english: Article 3A detention house shall establish a special detention area or detention cells for incarcerating and administering convicts.
sentences.chinese: 第三条看守所应当设置专门监区或者监室监管罪犯。

sentences.english: He is currently being held at the Suining City Detention Center.
sentences.chinese: 他目前被关押在遂宁市看守所。

sentences.english: The detention area and detention cells shall be established within the precinct of guard wall of the detention house.
sentences.chinese: 监区和监室应当设在看守所警戒围墙内。

sentences.english: Zhang returned home from the detention center has become quiet, sleepy all day long.
sentences.chinese: 张某从看守所回家后变得寡言少语，整天昏昏欲睡。

definition: public security bureau (government office similar in function to a police station)
to commit sb for trial/to bring sb for interrogation
police department/police station/abbr. of 警察局
to visit a prisoner (usu. a relative or friend)
release from custody, subject to provision of a surety, pending investigation (PRC)
